title: why arizona sheriff joe arpaio s fate could hang on a single word
context: reuters laura segall maricopa county sheriff joe arpaio announces newly launched program aimed at providing security around school in anthem arizona january 9 2013 phoenix a single word intentionally could transform a court case against phoenix area sheriff joe arpaio from civil charge to a criminal prosecution in finding arpaio and three of his top commander in contempt of court on friday u s district court judge murray snow said no fewer than 19 time that the sheriff or his aide had repeatedly and intentionally violated judicial order to stop profiling latino on may 31 snow will determine the civil penalty and examine whether arpaio the sheriff of arizona s maricopa county will be referred to arizona s u s attorney for potential criminal charge arpaio ha acknowledged violating snow s order but said it wa a mistake in weighing criminal charge snow must decide whether arpaio s violation of his order were intentional in the meantime the judge had unusually harsh word for arpaio the defendant unfair partial and inequitable application of discipline disproportionally sic damaged member of the plaintiff class snow wrote in a 2011 civil case brought by latino driver against arpaio and his aide snow determined that arpaio had encouraged his deputy to subject latino driver to greater scrutiny during traffic stop than white driver typically received he ordered the sheriff to put an end to the practice two year later snow found that arpaio had continued the practice in violation of the order at a houston rally the next year arpaio told supporter that he had violated the order out of spite and had arrested 500 people he later said in court filing that he had violated the order unknowingly in friday s ruling arpaio wa held in contempt on three count chief deputy jerry sheridan wa found in contempt on two count and retired chief brian sand and lt joe sousa each were found in contempt on one count the court find that the defendant have engaged in multiple act of misconduct dishonesty and bad faith snow wrote in their testimony during the evidentiary hearing sheriff arpaio and chief deputy sheridan made multiple intentional misstatement of fact while under oath in hearing last year arpaio the octogenarian who call himself america s toughest sheriff seemed to wither under questioning particularly when asked about an effort he had made to investigate the judge a lawyer for arpaio had hired a private investigator to look into comment snow s wife purportedly made in a restaurant where an informant claimed she had said the judge didn t want to see arpaio reelected arpaio apologized to snow for the investigation but the sheriff s attorney also used the incident to argue that snow wa no longer impartial and should recuse himself from the case snow declined in his contempt ruling snow said arpaio and his aide failed to turn over video evidence to plaintiff in the civil case disobeyed order to gather evidence and continued to profile latino snow found that arpaio hid thousand of piece of evidence from the plaintiff and deleted relevant digital evidence kept on hard drive longtime opponent immediately called for the sheriff to resign any public official who ha been found guilty of racial profiling and ignores the order of the court cannot be entrusted with the safety and well being of the community and should step down in shame the immigrant right group puente arizona said in a statement friday the aclu which brought the original case against arpaio demanded stricter oversight and transparency from the sheriff s office strong remedy are needed to protect the community s right starting with internal investigation that root out and punish misconduct said cecillia wang director of the aclu s immigrant right project willing or not the sheriff will be made to comply with the law the ruling friday wa one of arpaio s most serious defeat but it doesn t bar him from holding office and he had already announced his intention to run for a seventh term a sheriff in november
question: why arizona sheriff joe arpaio s fate could hang on a single word what is the word that could determine the fate of arizona sheriff joe arpaio

title: here s how much you should be tipping your hairdresser
context: here s how much you should be tipping your hairdressermore remembering how much you re supposed to tip anywhere can be hard what do current trend dictate is there such a thing a too much and what if you got a discount on the service but knowing how much to tip your hairdresser ha to be one of the more confusing tip scenario out there especially if you get your hair done at a salon where more than one person work on your strand below once and for all is a definitive guide to tipping your hairstylist and their assistant shampooist and everyone in between thank u later no tip necessary if you need a simple baseline expert agree that tipping 20 is standard and acceptable at any hair salon if you re in a smaller town 15 may be the norm you can always ask the receptionist at your salon what s typical or ask on the phone when you call to make your appointment offering the person who shampoo your hair 3 to 5 is a nice gesture you can hand the money directly to the shampooist or give it to the receptionist when you check out and ask them to pas it along a for your stylist s assistant that person is likely in training and may not be making much money so michelle lee master designer and manager at salon eva michelle in boston recommends tipping them between 5 and 20 all the assistant are there in training to be stylist and at many place a lot are working at minimum wage so anywhere from 5 to 20 is fine depending on how much they end up doing for the client or if they have been especially gracious to you she told instyle try to bring cash to tip if possible not every credit card machine will allow you to add a tip and using cash will make it easier to tip the different people who worked on your mane and yes it s ok to tip even if your hairdresser is the owner of the salon also if your salon offer free bang touch ups consider bringing a few dollar to leave a a thank you gesture your stylist will look fondly on you next time you come into the salon if you re a woman with shorter hair meaning you get it cut and or colored regularly your stylist will understand if you offer a slightly smaller tip after all your annual bill is much higher than a longer haired client s a for tipping on a discounted service stylist are split on the issue with some suggesting a 20 tip on the original price of the service and others saying a tip of 20 on the discounted rate is fine since the goal is to get you back into the salon when in doubt ask at the front desk finally if you re unsatisfied with your haircut communicated what you wanted to your stylist and talked to them about how to fix it but they refused to make change you can definitely lower your tip if they invite you back for a fix up cut though etiquette expert peggy post suggests offering a tip of 15 20
question: here s how much you should be tipping your hairdresser how much should you be tipping your hairdresser

title: alan rickman rupert grint on cbgb reuniting post potter and favorite halloween costume
context: the mythology of punk music s evolution can be traced back more or le to one singular staple cbgb opened in 1973 in downtown manhattan s east village the nightclub that originally intended to house country bluegrass and blue music hint it acronym quickly became a breeding ground for band like the ramones talking head and the police among countless others the legacy of the club which closed in 2006 over a rent dispute is on display in a new movie that star alan rickman a bemused owner hilly kristal it s a bit of a departure for anyone more accustomed to seeing rickman 67 play sinister severus snape in harry potter or judge turpin in sweeney todd the movie also afforded him the opportunity to reunite with fellow hogwarts alum rupert grint who portrays one third of derriere bearing punk band the dead boy alongside justin bartha and bronson adam they re joined by a revolving door of notable face including malin akerman a debbie harry taylor hawkins a iggy pop johnny galecki a terry ork and ashley greene a hilly s daughter lisa huffpost entertainment snagged some phone time with rickman and grint who were candid about their unfamiliarity with cbgb s legacy but effusive about the excitement that came with reconvening for the project plus grint talk about his own punk phase and rickman explains what halloween used to mean for him what are you up to today rickman i m in new york i m just here for three or four day for cbgb in new york and then back to work in england grint i m rehearsing a play that will start in london in a couple of week yeah so that s it are you enjoying the theater work are you more of a theater guy or a film guy grint i don t know really this is my first theater experience and it s very different i wanted to just try it it s something i ve always wanted to do just the thought of it scare me i ve kind of put it off for a long time and i just thought it wa a good time to do it and it s a great play and a really great cast with a great director and it wa just yeah i m enjoying it were you familiar with the legacy of cbgb a a breeding ground for the punk rock scene prior to taking your role in the movie rickman i wasn t familiar with cbgb at all i didn t know about it and didn t know it history i hadn t even really heard those four letter put together because at that time i wa very much in england a a drama student and an art student so it s all been a new discovery to me obviously i wa aware of some of the band but not that they d all started in a club on the bowery grint i didn t actually know a lot about it i d obviously heard of the name and the logo and seen it on t shirt and stuff like that but i didn t really know how prolific it wa in discovering some of my favorite band i love talking head and the whole punk thing wa something i really loved so yeah it wa quite an education learning about it and also dead boy i wasn t really familiar with them and kind of listening and watching them on youtube wa amazing they just had so much energy and they were just disgusting it wa incredible did you grow up listening to the music depicted in the movie rickman obviously i wa aware of the huge rise of the police in england and a an art student i wa very much a fan of talking head and then blondie but i wasn t a hard punk rock fan at the time but of course i wa also very much around the height of the beatles and the stone so it wa like that wa the lone star and everything spun off from there and bob dylan very much so england in the 60 and the 70 wa everything that history ha said it wa phenomenally exciting musically one wa very shaped by that grint it wa that whole era that i liked i like obviously the sex pistol and the clash blondie a well and the ramones some amazing people performed on that stage i went through a real punk phase not that long ago and yeah it wa probably the reason why i decided to do it because i have such a love for that did you dress similarly to the character that you play at any point grint laugh no not at all the dog collar wa a new experience for me not knowing much of the mythology of cbgb how did you come to learn about your character rickman what i really enjoyed and what made it interesting to play wa the fact that he happened in direct contrast to the world of the club and what it history became because there wa this big quiet contained man who made a club for country music and it never ever played there along came punk and he became like that deus ex machina i suppose i watched old interview and dvd i listened to him talking to his mother and his daughter and journalist so there wa a lot of material for me grint yeah there wasn t really a whole lot to go on there are a few video of him playing live at cbgb and a few interview i watched yeah and having dead boy guitarist cheetah chrome on set wa quite a different thing i had kind of a little bit of pressure because he wa kind of watching every scene and you re trying to portray him and do him justice and it s quite a challenge so he wa on set the whole time grint yeah he ha a cameo he play the cab driver he wa lovely he wa such a nice guy i wa kind of surprised he wa still alive did he give you any note while filming grint not so much note it wa just kind of watching him and being around him and listening to his story and just listening really kind of absorbing a lot of that and he wa such a nice guy and we had a good time wa this movie your first instance of nudity on camera grint yeah i guess it wa yeah were you comfortable with that how did that go down grint weirdly yeah it didn t really feel that big a deal it just kind of happened i didn t really think about it when i wa getting ready for it and yeah it just kind of happened i had some sort of sock modesty thing contraption i don t want to go into too much detail and yeah it wa just sort of one of those thing there wa quite a lot of that in the film especially from justin bartha a well there s quite a lot of as in the film you had to try out an american accent in this role is there an accent out there that you d be intimidated to have to use on camera rickman i think every english actor is nervous of a newcastle accent that s really difficult grint it s quite fun just trying to work on it and get it right i like that kind of challenge a couple year ago i did a film that required me to do a liverpool accent i don t know if you re familiar with that sound but that wa quite a hard one it s quite a harsh sound but i enjoy that side of thing once you started exploring the role and got into the dead boy and their history did you find yourself enjoying their music what did you think of the band you were portraying grint i really love them i listened to all their song completely their song are quite hard to play not easy to listen to but no i really love then i ve always really wanted to be in a band so this wa kind of an opportunity to experience that to go on stage and have the whole crowd there and the music is music something you d ever pursue grint i don t know probably not i ve tried to leverage it but i just know it s never going to happen alan you often play very dominant role very powerful people what were your thought going into a character who wa much more loose goosey is it fun to shift gear and play that sort of character rickman i suppose in my perspective i ve played a many of those a i have the other sort it s just some get more publicity or make more money at the box office or something i m perfectly happy to be colonel brandon in sense sensibility a i am any of those powerful character it s just part of an actor s job and you just alter the color that you get out of the cupboard how wa it to reunite had you seen each other since doing press for the eighth harry potter movie rickman no because i think we d both been so busy doing other thing but it wa great to see him on the set and it wa great to watch all three of them i saw emma watson the other night in london in a restaurant and i saw daniel radcliffe recently in london because he wa doing a play it s great to watch the three of them moving forward into the rest of their life and being working actor and not trapped by one image grint not really no actually i love alan he s always been one of my favorite but yeah it wa quite weird seeing him in a whole new kind of environment because i m trying to think back i don t think i ever really saw him outside of that wig and cloak which potter co star would you most like to reunite with grint there are so many all of them i ve already loved working with them i like michael gambon he s so cool just a remarkable guy i ve worked with julie walter before a well i love her she s great now for something more fun it s october what s your favorite halloween costume you ve ever worn rickman laugh the thing about halloween is to me it just mean because it s so different in england we used to have something called bonfire night and we d have firework that s disappeared and i know halloween s taken over halloween to me a a child wa the family would fill a bowl of water and you d have apple bobbing in it and you d get apple out of a bowl of water to me it just mean a soaking wet shirt grint i liked halloween it never used to be a big thing when i wa kid we never really did it but i actually had a good costume not that long ago the last one i dressed a a play doh can that i made you know play doh of course grint well literally i actually made it it wa a yellow bin i cut the bottom out and i just wore a yellow bin with a play doh logo with a yellow hat it s not very practical do you have a favorite halloween candy rickman i don t even know what that mean the word chocolate would loom large grint a favorite halloween candy i don t really know i never trick or treated when i wa younger because we lived on a block of house that were all just kind of elderly people who were just scared to answer the door but yeah candy corn that s a big thing i ve tried that that s pretty great cbgb is out in limited release now

title: sprite may be the best hangover cure chinese researcher say
context: most of u are familiar with the pounding headache drowsiness stomach turning nausea and did i get run over by a bus sensation that come with that most dreaded of morning after ailment the hangover to alleviate the suffering chugging coffee downing advil or simply choosing to forego the wretched day altogether by returning to bed sometimes doe the trick but what if there were a miracle elixir that could chase that hangover cloud away and better still what if that magic drink were something you could easily pick up at your local supermarket a group of chinese researcher say that they may have indeed found this perfect hangover cure and it go by the name of sprite after examining 57 beverage in a lab researcher hua bin li and his colleague at sun yat sen university in guangzhou determined that sprite wa one of the drink that best relieved hangover symptom the team of scientist had hypothesized that what you consume after drinking booze could alter the effect of alcohol on your body specifically they theorized that certain drink could impact the body s metabolism of alcohol in a way that would help alleviate hangover symptom chemistry world explains it this way some of the adverse effect of alcohol are thought to be caused not by the ethanol itself but by ethanol s first metabolite acetaldehyde ethanol is metabolized into acetaldehyde by the enzyme alcohol dehydrogenase adh and then into acetate by aldehyde dehydrogenase aldh unlike acetaldehyde acetate is innocuous and may even be responsible for some of the positive health benefit of alcohol consumption therefore the key to reducing alcohol related damage lie in minimizing the amount of time acetaldehyde is present in the body the chinese researcher therefore decided that they would look at how the different beverage impacted the activity of adh and aldh some beverage were found to be terrible for a hangover an herbal infusion with hemp seed for example wa discovered to boost the activity of adh while inhibiting aldh therefore slowing down the breakdown of acetaldehyde and dragging out the hangover effect on the other hand some drink including sprite known in china a xue bi and a type of soda water were found to have the opposite effect increasing the activity of aldh and thus speeding up the breakdown of acetaldehyde the researcher are reportedly planning to conduct the test in living organism but the result have already generated a lot of buzz a people around the world celebrate the possible death of the hangover however expert warn that we shouldn t quite raise the victory flag just yet edzard ernst a medicinal science expert from the university of exeter told chemistry world that while he found the study interesting more research is necessary before we wholeheartedly embrace the result do you have a tried and tested hangover cure that you swear by tell u below
question: this popular soda could cure your hangover scientist say what is the name of the popular soda that scientist say could cure hangover

title: do bird fart
context: have you ever wondered do bird fart no well maybe now we ve sparked your curiosity they don t fart detectably there s no reason to believe that bird are somehow exempt from passing gas but it doesn t seem like anyone ha ever truly observed or more importantly measured a bird fart but between ornithologist veterinarian and amateur bird watcher how is it possible no one ha ever seen the feathered creature flatulate a monterey bay aquarium veterinarian mike murray said in a 2009 article for popular science bird are capable of passing gas but they don t because they lack the same combination of diet and gas forming bacteria in their gut that give mammal their odorous gas murray added that if he spotted gas in an x ray of a bird s gastrointestinal tract he d be concerned something wa wrong with the bird but laura eriksen a birder educator and blogger at the cornell lab of ornithology ha a different theory in a blog post on her website she posit that bird have much shorter digestive tract than mammal so there s le time for gas to build up allowing fart to slip by undetected in another blog post she describes the only written account she s aware of describing a possible bird fart it come from former cornell student alan richard weisbrod in his 1965 master s thesis on blue jay one of the bird in front of me defecated a small puff of whitish gas wa expelled along with the feces the feces dropped from the bird while the gas wafted below and parallel to the slightly raised tail until it dissipated rapidly into the cold air the gas could be clearly seen against the dark colored eave that hang over the sheltered perch upon which the bird were fluffed and resting several day later a bird perched in the same position wa observed to defecate with the accompanying wisp of whitish gas weisbrod go on to describe how bird eat similar diet to many mammal who definitely flatulate but explains that he could not find any other account of bird flatulence at that time and apparently no scientist ha stepped up to the plate to follow up on weisbrod s observation he also acknowledges that the wisp of whitish gas could also have simply been water vapor steam rising from the feces just think of how your dog s poop steam in the cold when you take him out for his daily business in the winter it s a little difficult to know for sure that bird rarely or never fart according to mental_floss human fart are smelly due to a combination of our diet and the microbe in our gut that help digest the food in our diet a video by asapscience add that the longer the food stay in the gut the more time it ha to ferment and break down into it smellier component namely sulfur so if bird don t have the right food microbe combo and intestinal length to produce smelly gas then we wouldn t smell it without a smell bird fart rustle no one s feather but even if bird produced immaculate odorless gas would we hear it that is le clear according to a q a with proctologist lester gottesman in vice fart make a sound due to the composition of gas and the shape read tightness of the sphincter a lot of the gas that make up a fart gottesman said is swallowed air and a lot of swallowed air lead to a lot of gas which can make a bigger beefier noise but how much air doe a swallow swallow when a swallow swallow air a far a we could tell this isn t a question any scientist ha specifically tried to measure but the daily dot reached out to the cornell lab of ornithology for answer nonetheless according to an ornithologist there relayed via email by the lab s good humored press officer miyoko chu bird definitely swallow air but he think they expel it via burping rather than farting he added that he think bird do fart in some case and would depend on what specie their diet and whether it is observable he also said that he s never personally noticed a bird fart lastly maybe they do swallow enough air that would leave most animal saying excuse me after a butt bellow but perhaps something about the construction of the erm exit point keep it from making a sound this is pure speculation but maybe something about having feather around the bird s cloaca it all purpose back end chute help the fart slip by unnoticed and without a smell bird fart rustle no one s feather

title: the one morning work mistake you can t recover from
context: rolling into the office around 9 30 a m every day may be killing your career even if you stay late to put in a full day s worth of work a new study from the university of washington s foster school of business found that despite working the same amount of time a worker who start the day earlier will come off a more conscientious and consequently receive better performance review than someone who start later past study have shown that giving worker a little leeway in setting their hour make them happier and more productive presumably a win for both the employee and the company that s why company like google and microsoft let employee work from home or adjust their schedule to account for personal responsibility like taking a child to school in the morning but the study suggests a downside your bos may be unconsciously judging you for giving yourself a later start time regardless of how much work you re getting done in the study which will be published in full in the journal of applied psychology later this year researcher asked 149 supervisor to rate an employee s performance employee start time ranged from 5 a m to 9 45 a m even when employee who started later in the day worked the same number of hour a those who started earlier supervisor were inclined to rate employee who began work earlier a more conscientious and gave them higher performance rating boss who preferred to work later hour themselves were le inclined to display this morning bias in a second experiment the researcher assigned a group of 141 college student the role of a supervisor and asked each student to review a profile of a fictitious employee the performance of the fictional employee wa the same in all case but start time varied across profile researcher found that employee who worked from 7 a m to 3 p m were consistently given higher rating of conscientiousness and performance by the student supervisor than employee who worked from 11 a m to 7 p m the researcher concluded that employee who can opt for flexible work schedule should shift their schedule earlier not later to account for manager morning bias it seems likely that some employee are experiencing a decrement in their performance rating that is not based on anything having to do with their actual performance the three researcher wrote in a post for the harvard business review this morning bias appears to be deeply ingrained in a word association experiment designed to test the implicit stereotype that early riser are more diligent worker the researcher also found that a majority of the 120 working adult surveyed linked word associated with the morning like sunrise with word associated with conscientiousness like industriousness another recent study covered by the new york time further suggests there may be an implicit view among some manager that employee who take advantage of flexible work policy in any way are le conscientious than employee who work more traditional hour most organization still treat workplace flexibility a an accommodation erin kelly a sociology professor at the university of minnesota told the time you are implicitly saying most of u will be working these traditional way and the reward will come to those working these traditional way and that is where you have this stigma or career penalty although the study did not consider gender it seems woman could be more adversely affected by morning bias than men that s because more woman than men are primary caregiver for their child and assume a disproportionate amount of household task according to a 2013 bureau of labor statistic report study have shown that woman take advantage of workplace telecommuting policy more often than men for the same reason and that their career may suffer a a result of not logging a much face time at the office
question: the one morning work mistake you can t recover from what is the one morning work mistake you can t recover from

title: phil and jeanie basketball s ultimate power couple call it quits

a distance in the way he said the lakers this after all is the man who won five nba title in los angeles and wa still engaged to lakers president jeanie bus but that distance wa real and it had kept growing a the year went by and jackson spent more and more time in new york running the knicks and in montana with his child and grandchild during the offseason his connection with los angeles and his fiance e wa simply too hard to maintain on tuesday night bus and jackson announced that they were mutually ending their four year engagement the announcement via their personal twitter account brought an end to the nba s version of camelot like the camelot in richard burton s broadway musical this had always been an impossible romance the owner s daughter dating the team s coach and not just any owner only one of the most powerful owner of all time lakers owner dr jerry bus and not just any coach only the most successful nba coach of all time then there were hurdle such a jeanie bus being the team s vice president in charge of business affair at the time and her brother jim bus being in charge of basketball operation so many tangled web and yet jeanie bus and jackson somehow made it work for 17 year during the best of time when the lakers were winning nba championship they d ride to the arena together from their house in marina del rey at game jeanie would sit with her girlfriend linda rambis and stacy kennedy in the second row across the court from the lakers bench where phil could see her and the player could hear her once on the drive in jackson mentioned lamar odom needed a little extra encouragement a he adjusted to his new role a a sixth man so during the game bus and her girlfriend made a point of cheering for odom a he checked into the game take your pant off they yelled out a odom shed his warm ups near the scorer table he beamed at the attention it wa a small thing but it wa those kind of gesture that made the impossible relationship work for so many year the way they d work in tandem and share thought about the team with each other that wa camelot once jackson retired a coach in 2011 thing started changing at first he wa home all the time plotting his next move he had no intention of coaching again his body couldn t take it and his spirit wa leading him in other direction toward a front office career which would allow him to test his principle from on high way above the court but when dr bus wa diagnosed with terminal cancer in 2012 and the franchise needed a coach of some stature to come in and lead the team of superstar kobe bryant pau gasol dwight howard and steve nash for what appeared to be dr bus last ride jackson raised his hand a always he would do it for jeanie this time the lakers didn t call on him or rather general manager mitch kupchak called him around midnight to tell him the lakers had chosen to hire mike d antoni instead jackson wa livid his agent issued a blistering statement decrying the disrespect shown to the coach who had won five title for l a and wa willing to come out of retirement to coach the team and help his fiancee s family at a critical juncture it did not break apart their relationship though if anything it strengthened it about six week later jackson proposed to jeanie bus his knee and hip were too stiff to get down on one knee not that he is the grand gesture type anyway what wa important is that he knew getting engaged would make her happy and give her father some peace a he lay dying the engagement wa almost destined to stay at that level once jackson became president of the knicks in 2014 jackson and bus had to sign document that ensured there would be no conflict of interest between the two franchise according to source that included a provision that the nba and it owner be informed if they ever decided to marry so now not only were they living apart they couldn t talk about their job when they were together if they ever did decide to marry it would further complicate their business relationship a the year went by jackson focused in on the knicks and bus focused on the lakers he would come to los angeles when he could and she would see him in new york when she attended board of governor meeting but friend say it got harder and harder to find time to connect both of their legacy are tied to what they do next bus must decide whether to reboot the lakers front office jackson need to make the knicks into a contender those close to jackson say he intends to stay for the full five year of his contract with the knicks despite the mutual option that s built into his contract this summer there had been speculation that jackson could return to the lakers this offseason when they might need a new guide in the front office and he could amicably part from new york those are the type of implausible thing that happen in camelot it wa never meant to be bus ha been spending the past year supervising the development of the team s new practice facility and working tirelessly on the league s new collective bargaining agreement she also ha maintained close tie with first year coach luke walton which is a departure from her distant relationship with previous lakers coach those close to bus say she also ha been giving more thought to the looming question of the team s front office all of those are massive thing that jackson and bus simply couldn t talk about given their current role so the impossible relationship officially came to a loving end tuesday night camelot wa over

title: edward gorey return to hometown with new chicago exhibition
context: despite the fact that renowned author and illustrator edward gorey wa born in chicago and spent a sizable chunk of his formative year in the windy city his work ha never been recognized with it own exhibition that is until now beginning earlier this month and continuing through june 15 the macabre creation of the late gorey are front and center for two concurrent exhibition at the loyola university museum of art luma in chicago one of the show elegant enigma the art of edward gorey is a touring exhibition organized by the brandywine museum in chadds ford penn that offer a comprehensive look at his illustration a well a work by other artist he influenced the second exhibition g is for gorey c is for chicago pull from the collection of loyola alumnus thomas michalak a member of the board of director of the edward gorey house in massachusetts who ha collected gorey material for over two decade it includes a number of rare item offering a deeper look at the mysterious man behind the art including some of his report card early drawing and book cover he designed and the ornately decorated envelope of letter he sent to his mother helen pam ambrose director of luma told huffpost the show aim to address the lack of awareness of gorey s chicago root in addition to tracing the man s development from a budding artist to an acclaimed cultural icon who inspired creator like daniel handler and tim burton his influence is also felt in summerland a ghost story a small mixed medium installation by chicago artist kenneth gerleve that s also also included in the show i want people to really think about who this man wa ambrose said because he appears to be many contradiction in one persona but wa this a persona invented to keep people away it s very hard to say he seems like someone who shapeshifts a bit the luma show have been a hit they had people lined up outside the front door on opening day pretty good for a university museum ambrose noted ticket to a saturday bash celebrating what would have been gorey s 89th birthday sold quickly while gorey will forever be linked to gothic subculture thanks in large part to his signature victorian character dressed in head to toe black the show paint a broader portrait of the artist than that for example prominently placed illustration of cat throughout the show acknowledge his fascination with feline and many of his kid centric illustration feel downright giddy when compared to his familiar somber style this is an artist who wa much more important than the immediate perception of just the gothic tale or cautionary tale ambrose said

title: the oven cleaning hack that will have your appliance sparkling in minute without any scrubbing from removing grease with oil to banishing bad smell with water
context: scrubbing the oven is one of the most dreaded spring cleaning job but now a new series of kitchen hack reveals how you can get your appliance sparkling in no time at all by using just a few simple product you probably already have in your home from removing oil by adding more oil to banishing bad smell with lemon and water these are the very easy and cheap trick that will clean what is often the filthiest part of a kitchen 1 create your own cleaner a nifty cleaning cheat for treating stubborn stain is to use a homemade oven cleaner advises rik hellewell founder and md at oven valeting service ovenu who put together the tip this help save you time and money a simple mixture of white vinegar and baking soda work wonder to help remove grease and grime the vinegar will react with the baking soda to foam gently rub the paste onto the area you need to treat and leave it for 30 minute to get to work then once the time s up you should be able to wipe the dirt away easily 2 clean shelf in 30 minute when wa the last time you removed the shelf from your oven asks rik probably not that recently however in order to cook your food in a hygienic environment you need to ensure that you keep them sparkling clean a quick way to restore your shelf to their former glory is to place the shelf in a resealable plastic bag spray with oven cleaner seal the bag then leave to soak make sure you read the instruction on the cleaning product and wear protective clothing where necessary after 30 minute remove the shelving from the resealable bag rinse them under warm water and use a scourer to scrub away any remaining burnt on food 3 use an old toothbrush an old toothbrush is an essential oven cleaning tool it soft bristle and flexible head allow you to clean area that would otherwise be out of reach even better if you use an electric toothbrush the vibration will help to loosen any burnt on food 4 use a glass scraper a glass scraper is ideal for removing tough stain from the door and floor of your oven if the door is removable unscrew it and soak in oven cleaner and warm water then scrape the stuck on food residue away 5 remove oil with oil it may sound strange but you can remove greasy build up on the hood of your oven with oil in fact this technique will make clean ups in the future really easy place a couple of drop of vegetable oil onto a paper towel and rub it over the greasy area the oil help to remove the grease without the use of any harsh chemical once clean spray the area with all purpose oven cleaner to ensure that no oil remains 6 banish bad smell easily we ve all cooked a wonderful meal only to have the smell linger for day if you ve cooked something especially pungent like fish a few drop of vanilla or citrus essence can work wonder simply add a few drop in an ovenproof bowl filled with water slowly heat the bowl for an hour and you ll soon rid your kitchen of those pong 7 use car wax for grease a dirty hob is a sure sign of a dirty oven a thin layer of car wax on your hob can help remove built up grease simply apply and wipe away if any dirt remains don t worry to get a ceramic hob clean sprinkle with baking soda and a few drop of water then wipe clean with a soft cloth if your oven ha steel burner then place them in a resealable bag overnight with a drop of bleach and warm water the next day wipe the burner down and wash in warm soapy water 8 polish with cream of tartar cream of tartar may seem like an odd cleaning product to use on your oven but it is extremely effective at keeping stainless steel shiny simply apply with a thin cloth leave for 10 minute then wipe away 9 remove stuck on food with dishwasher tablet dishwasher tablet are excellent at removing stuck on food from your pot and pan in a dishwasher so why should your oven be any different take a dishwasher tablet and dip half of it in warm water next rub the tablet over the built up grease on your oven door and watch the burnt on dirt wash away with minimal effort 10 how to never scrub again there s a very quick and easy way to battle grease and grime make sure that your oven is completely cool and then spray oven cleaner into the corner leave overnight if you can if not leave for at least four hour after the product ha worked it magic you should be able to simply wipe the grime away if any burnt on food remains cover with your homemade cleaning solution of white vinegar and baking soda

s bill ha jumped from six all the way up to um eight no senator ha come forward with similar legislation jolly appearing monday morning at the national press club with his lead democratic co sponsor rep rick nolan minn wa not surprised we ve got six more co sponsor than i thought we might have he said it s a heartbreaking reflection on what the priority of the congress are a member s political supreme court s citizen united decision allowing corporation and union to spend unlimited sum on politics but that ultimate fix isn t happening soon in the house rep john sarbanes d md ha recruited 160 co sponsor for his system of public financing of election another good idea but so far he ha only one republican gadfly walter jones n c republican remain reflexively opposed to reform including the idea of disclosure which senate majority leader mitch mcconnell r ky once championed this is why jolly s idea deserves a look he call it congressional reform not campaign finance reform the goal to get lawmaker to spend more time lawmaking we re here three day a week and half your time is spent raising money he said in the face of growing crisis around the globe you ve got a part time wouldn t have to do the dirty work but while jolly can be accused of election year gimmickry he voluntarily refused to solicit contribution for his senate run and though the bill wouldn t by itself solve the campaign finance mess it could help to improve the woeful political culture in other way jolly s democratic sidekick nolan said that when he first served in congress in the 1970s lawmaker worked full week giving them time to develop respect for one another and to find common ground if you ve already consumed 40 50 hour of the week in travel and fundraising there s not a lot of time left over for governing and we re seeing the result of that he said we re looking at the last couple of session of the congress of the united state a being the most unproductive in the history of the country why well if everybody s busy campaigning and raising money there s no time for governing the little support jolly ha gained for the idea come largely from florida home to three of his eight co sponsor including democrat alan grayson also a senate candidate a democratic congressional candidate in florida businessman randy perkins went one step further announcing he would stop soliciting or accepting financial contribution but jolly a former lobbyist and longtime staffer to the late congressman c w bill young continues to agitate he said he s not paying his 400 000 in due to the nrcc and he said i don t buy the notion that he need more sponsor before house leadership grant a hearing on his bill jolly is a potential ally of democrat on campaign finance reform saying that citizen united could be revisited and that we can do better until then surely more lawmaker on both side can see the virtue of his cause you think you get elected to represent 700 000 people he said but you actually got elected to be one more marble on our side of the aisle to keep the majority and to do that you ve got to go raise 2 million and that make member angry or at least it should

title: i wa really bad at sport in high school this study help me understand why
context: i wa a horrible lacrosse player in high school bad at catching the ball slow and not very aggressive yet i d spend hour at a handball wall with my stick throwing catching repeating i played on winter league and woke up early for 6 am pickup game freshman and sophomore year i made it onto the junior varsity team a miracle by 11th grade it wa time to try out for varsity lacrosse this is when my history teacher the varsity coach pulled me aside and suggested i shouldn t bother i d probably be cut he said adding that i wa getting very good grade for me practice did not make perfect lo and behold i now have scientific validation a meta analysis in perspective in psychological science looked at 33 study on the relationship between deliberate practice and athletic achievement and found that practice just doesn t matter that much more precisely the analysis found practice can account for 18 percent of the difference in athletic success put another way if we compare batting average between two baseball player the amount of time the player spent in the batting cage would only account for 18 percent of the reason one player s average is better than the other even more simply some people are just better at sport than others and the difference cannot be made up by practice alone there wa a reason i lagged behind my peer on the lacrosse field they probably had a natural advantage on me one important thing that s easy to misunderstand is that this is looking at variance across people not within an individual brooke macnamara the lead author of the perspective paper tell me so if a person practice they will get better almost across the board practice should improve one s performance but it also mean that for the same amount of practice some will end up being better at sport than others essentially learning rate vary macnamara say some people improve very quickly with le practice while others require much more practice the analysis found this 18 percent figure is roughly true no matter what type of sport is being played practice account for the same difference in performance in bowling a it doe field hockey two completely different activity practice also explains fewer difference in ability the further an athlete ascends into higher level of play which suggests deliberate practice loses it predictive power beyond a certain level of skill the study report the analysis also found that the age when athlete started their sport didn t change this figure much either so what then explains the remaining 82 percent here s where we should note a limitation of studying practice researcher typically ask athlete to recall their schedule and practice hour and memory can be faulty but macnamara doesn t think better measurement of practice would make that 18 percent figure leap up to near 100 there s probably not one huge contributor that s accounting for everything else she say instead there s likely a whole constellation of factor some of which are genetic or biological in nature that explain why some people are better athlete than others they include personality and perseverance propensity to get injured propensity to choke under pressure individual difference in maximum oxygen uptake difference in how we acquire muscle mass coordination height enjoyment of competition we have so many factor within a person that can contribute to athletic performance different gene different cognitive ability different physical attribute she say all of those thing are important and interact with each other which is why it is so hard to pin down what predicts performance overall she say the finding is a strike against the popular 10 000 hour rule which implies anyone can become master at an activity if they were to just devote the time to it the research in sport and in other activity such a music game and education just doesn t back that hypothesis up on the other hand it s not like these finding are an excuse not to try eighteen percent is big macnamara say we re trying to argue against these idea that it s so important it account for nearly everything practice matter but it s unlikely to bridge the gap between inborn superstar and your average or perhaps clumsy kid for the athletically un inclined like myself it s a bit of a relief it s okay if you can t make up the difference with practice or if you re just a slow learner when it come to sport it s also okay to just enjoy being on a team trying hard but knowing you ll unlikely be the best growing up my dad wa on a quest to find my sport the activity i d finally master lacrosse wa the closest we came but it wa mostly a parade of failure baseball throw a ball at me and i ll be more likely to bruise than catch it soccer i wa much too slow basketball all of the above tennis i wa cut from the middle school team i m not a well coordinated person and that s just fine these day i stick to activity that don t involve hand eye coordination hiking biking running skiing i love physical activity life s just too short to spend it on activity you re horrible at
question: i wa really bad at sport in high school this new study help me understand why what is the main reason for the author s poor performance in sport during high school

text: some people are just better at sport than others

title: one word that should never follow i love you
context: i don t remember the exact day or the exact reason or even the exact word but i know it started with i love you but it could have been i love you but you re driving me crazy or any of the following i love you but you re not listening to me i love you but stop leaving dirty dish in the sink or i love you but i need some alone time i ve begun many a sentence with those four word and never paused for a moment to think about what they mean what are we actually conveying when we begin a sentence like that what my husband heard wasn t the first part of the sentence but the second every time what he heard wa i love you if and i would love you if only you would he didn t like it he said so and i m glad he did he wa right i wa throwing i love you in to soften the blow but let s be honest when you say it like that the purpose of the statement is to communicate everything except i love you the but slice the top of the sentence off and the i love you get discarded like a strawberry s calyx i love you usually the most beautiful and powerful triad of word in the world becomes inauthentic and trivial cheap a throwaway line my husband asked if i could replace the word but with the word and i stopped and repeated the sentence i had just said to him with the revision and the light bulb inside my head nearly blinded me with epiphany i love you and you are driving me crazy suddenly his driving me crazy wa no longer an exception to my loving him it wa part and parcel of the package i could love him and be driven crazy by him simultaneously a little conjunction transduction made all the difference it took me a while to make the change in my delivery permanent but it wa worth the effort it ha made a significant difference in my communication with my husband and now my kid above all else i want my family to know that i love them regardless of circumstance even if they are driving me crazy
question: one word that should never follow i love you what is the word that should never follow i love you

title: college president this is not a day care this is a university
context: this fall protest at yale princeton duke and the university of missouri where the chancellor and system president resigned in the midst of turmoil drew national attention to the concern many service and complain because he felt victimized by a sermon on the topic of 1 corinthian 13 it appears that this young scholar felt offended because a homily on love made him feel bad for not showing love in his mind the speaker wa wrong for making him and his peer feel uncomfortable i m not making this up our culture ha actually taught our kid to be this self absorbed and narcissistic any time their feeling are hurt they are the victim anyone who dare challenge them and thus make them feel bad about themselves is a hater a bigot an oppressor and a victimizer i have a message for this young man and all others who care to listen that feeling of discomfort you have after listening to a sermon is called a conscience an altar call is supposed to make you feel bad it is supposed to make you feel guilty the goal of many a good sermon is to get you to confess your sin not coddle you in your selfishness the primary objective of the church and the christian faith is your confession not your self actualization so here s my advice if you want the chaplain to tell you you re a victim rather than tell you that you need virtue this may not be the university you re looking for if you want to complain about a sermon that make you feel le than loving for not showing love this might be the wrong place if you re more interested in playing the hater card than you are in confessing your own hate if you want to arrogantly lecture rather than humbly learn if you don t want to feel guilt in your soul when you are guilty of sin if you want to be enabled rather than confronted there are many university across the land in missouri and elsewhere that will give you exactly what you want but oklahoma wesleyan isn t one of them at okwu we teach you to be selfless rather than self centered we are more interested in you practicing personal forgiveness than political revenge we want you to model interpersonal reconciliation rather than foment personal conflict we believe the content of your character is more important than the color of your skin we don t believe that you have been victimized every time you feel guilty and we don t issue trigger warning before altar call oklahoma wesleyan is not a safe place but rather a place to learn to learn that life isn t about you but about others that the bad feeling you have while listening to a sermon is called guilt that the way to address it is to repent of everything that s wrong with you rather than blame others for everything that s wrong with them this is a place where you will quickly learn that you need to grow up this is not a day care this is a university

ability to host guest speaker state lawmaker are moving forward this week with a vote on legislation that would bar the university of tennessee ut and other public institution of higher education from using institutional revenue to engage and pay visiting or guest speaker for event even commencement speaker who asked the school to cover travel and lodging cost or who sought a speaker fee would be eliminated the legislation would not prevent the hiring of guest faculty to conduct class for which student receive credit another bill would require state college to distribute student fee to pay for guest speaker proportionally based on membership of the student group inviting the speaker both of these bill were authored by state sen stacey campfield r knoxville and were scheduled for their first committee vote on wednesday they are being pushed in response to sex week a week long student organized and student funded event at ut s knoxville campus discussing sexuality lgbt issue sexual health and related topic campfield previously gained national recognition and stirred national controversy in 2012 for his don t say gay bill which would have prevented schoolteacher from discussing homosexuality the legislation ultimately did not pas that year or when it wa resurrected in 2013 last week two other state senator education committee chairwoman dolores gresham r somerville and government operation committee chairman mike bell r riceville issued a letter to university leader warning that state funding for the university may be in jeopardy even though no taxpayer fund went toward sex week gov bill haslam r ha not said whether he would sign the bill into law university leader have repeatedly explained to lawmaker that they could not block sex week because the first administrator said in february that the university had received no call of complaint from local community member or alumnus nonetheless the tennessee state house ha already passed a resolution condemning the student who organized sex week which the house called an atrocious event on monday a petition opposing campfield s bill signed by 3 500 student wa presented at the statehouse in addition 650 student letter were sent to lawmaker friday a ut knoxville graduate student provided the huffington post with a form email she received from campfield in response to her objection to his legislation the lawmaker said while i support diversity of thought at the university what is currently in place is not diversity sadly when you look at a list of the paid speaker for the university the vast majority are from one point of view and balancing point of view are minimized ut administration and faculty leader who firmly oppose both bill agree with campfield on that one point that a university should be a place where many voice are heard if people realize we re an institution that doesn t allow outside speaker i think that could have a significant impact ut faculty senate president david golden told the tv station wate i can think of no better place for contradictory conflicting controversial idea to be presented than on a university campus

title: explainer is there any science behind astrology
context: photo credit pixabay com looking at the star sign from a scientific standpoint a hospital in argentina is reportedly using astrology to help treat some mental health condition like depression and anxiety by giving patient an understanding of their astrological personality the guidance is given based on the patient s sign whether he or she is an aries taurus or so forth and the leading astrologist develops a star chart for each patient unsurprisingly the astrology workshop is being met with criticism over it scientific validity diego andre s golombek a professor at the university of quilmes in argentina told quartz astrology can be harmless of course unless it give direction and instruction into how to proceed with for example an illness or medical treatment see also 6 question to ask before sharing science on the internet and indeed having such a program organized by a hospital lead into the completely false assumption that astrology might have some kind of scientific background which of course it completely lack i am horrified by this prospect so based on the evidence or lack thereof is there any real science to support astrology there are a few foundational way to evaluate whether a concept is scientific and the university of california berkeley s understanding science website lay out a science checklist 1 doe astrology use testable idea for something to have a true scientific basis it ha to encompass testable idea however a understanding science explains some expectation generated by astrology are so general that any outcome could be interpreted a fitting the expectation if treated this way astrology is not testable 2 doe it rely on evidence there haven t been many study that investigate the science behind astrology but of the few that have the result have failed to support the validity of astrological view for instance a study tested the accuracy of astrological chart in describing the personality trait of 193 study participant and the result indicated that the score were at a level consistent with chance so far it can t be said that astrology relies on replicable scientific evidence and replicability is a must for an idea to prove itself a valid 3 doe it attempt to explain the natural world yes astrology s basic premise is that the sun moon planet and constellation have an effect on human and earthly event further it us a set of rule about the relative position and movement of the star and planet to predict and explain worldly event and human personality however a understanding science explains although astrologer seek to explain the natural world they don t usually attempt to critically evaluate whether those explanation are valid and this is a key part of science plus astrology doesn t lead to ongoing research which is another key part of science so unfortunately for everyone who swears their daily horoscope is always on point or blame their stubbornness on being a scorpio or a taurus it appears that there s not much scientific evidence to back those claim until then astrology will have to remain in the realm of pseudoscience you should read this next science explainer why gmos aren t harmful to your health

title: these are the shower habit that you need to ditch
context: did you know there actually a right way to shower get ready turn down that water temperature and drop the shampoo here are the thing you need to stop doing while showering showering is and should be a daily habit for most of u and everyone ha their own routine some people can t live without washing their hair each day while others chose to skip a day or two and the difference continue on from there however did you know that some of the most common shower habit might not actually be that healthy believe it or not some of the thing you do every day while taking a shower could be affecting you in way you ve never thought of check out this list to see if your shower habit are doing you more harm than good 1 washing your face without a doubt it s easier and le messy to wash your face when you re already in the shower however despite the convenience it s actually not good for your face the water that you shower in will typically be much hotter than what you d wash with at the sink and the high temperature can make your skin dry out very quickly those with skin condition such a acne or rosacea may also find that washing their face with hot water can cause excessive redness and irritation it could even burst a blood vessel in your face if you wash too aggressively use a gentle cleanser and avoid washing your face in the shower particularly if you have acne prone skin or rosacea 2 not washing your foot you might be thinking that your foot make contact with plenty of water while you re in the shower so there s no real reason to actually bend down and give them a proper wash you d be wrong though even if you re not prone to smelly foot think about how sweaty your foot can get throughout the day not only that but if you re known to walk around the house or outdoors without sock or shoe you never know what you might be picking up along the way there s no excuse for just letting the soap suds run down to your toe anymore imagine what you re bringing into your bed every night without giving those foot a good wash 3 not washing or replacing your loofah regularly be honest how long ha the same loofah been hanging in your shower month year a it turn out that can be terrible for your health this video demonstrates why consider treating yourself to a new sponge or loofah the next time you re out or create a cute and convenient place to hang the one you have for air drying 4 using a soap dish yes that built in soap dish is there forever but using it for it intended purpose actually isn t that good of an idea the majority of people don t use bar of soap these day but for those who do be aware that leaving a bar of soap in one spot could be encouraging bacteria to grow on it bacteria that you re then going to spread over your entire body the next time you lather up if you have reason for resisting the switch to liquid body wash try finding a wire soap dish or one that ha hole in the bottom so any remaining water can drain away once you re out of the shower 5 using scented soap yes those soap that make your bathroom smell like a tropical rainforest or a freshly made vanilla cupcake do transport you to a place of olfactory luxury while sudsing up but those very fragrance could be doing a number on your skin at the same time anyone who notice their skin seems particularly irritated after a shower should look to their soap a the first culprit fragrance can irritate sensitive skin very easily so it s best to use something unscented to keep your skin in the best shape plus you won t have to worry about the scent of your soap mixing with the scent of your perfume to create questionable smell 6 showering in hard water some people may not even know how to tell if their water is considered hard but figuring it out and taking step to adjust it could save your hair and skin from a lot of damage hard water is defined by it high concentration of mineral like magnesium and calcium which can end up making your skin break out or cause a layer of buildup on your hair those with dyed hair may even find that hard water strip the color out of their strand or at least cause their tint to fade a little quicker if you re unable to add a water softener to your shower try incorporating a clarifying shampoo into your routine to remove any buildup caused by those pesky mineral 7 avoiding cold shower most people wouldn t even dream of standing in cold water for more than a second let alone taking an entire shower in water that s anything le than steaming hot still cold water shower can actually be really beneficial for your skin and hair and you only need 30 second under a cold stream to see a difference a quick blast of cold water is said to improve your immune function increase your metabolism and increase the amount of stress you can tolerate in addition to speeding up your metabolism a study done in 2009 suggests that regularly taking a cold shower could even help you lose weight over time 8 using old razor for most of u old razor aren t something we thoughtfully replace on a regular basis instead they just sit in the shower until we finally cave and get a new one razor whether you re buying replacement head or the kind that are entirely disposable are surprisingly expensive so why throw one out after a certain period of time if it still seems to work well just because a razor is shaving off your unwanted hair doesn t mean it s doing so effectively if you notice that your skin get red and inflamed after you shave it s because the blade are dull and it s time for a replacement 9 leaving your razor in the shower remember how leaving your wet bar of soap in your dingy old soap dish make it a breeding ground for bacteria the same thing go for your razor there are plenty of nook and cranny in your razor that make perfect spot for bacteria to hide and the problem will only get worse when the razor is sitting in a warm wet environment if you don t actually want to store your razor outside of the shower at least make sure that you hang it up when you re done using it so it can air dry 10 over exfoliating giving your skin a gentle scrub every now and then is a good idea but doing so every day could actually be causing damage for anyone who doesn t know your skin actually exfoliates itself by renewing every 27 day or so anyone who chooses to exfoliate their skin every day is aggressively going after fresh skin cell which can make your skin red and irritated a a result it s best to let some dead cell build up on the surface of your skin before reaching for your favorite scrub so that you know there s actually something there worth exfoliating

other prion disease in other animal could say hunter get sick from eating infected deer that s what researcher in north america including belay are trying to find out right now chronic wasting disease in north america is spreading fast say belay the disease cause infected wild deer and elk to starve to death in early 2000 we had about three state that reported cwd in the wild in deer and elk today that number is 21 belay say the disease is a little bit concerning because unlike mad cow disease and kuru where infectious prion were concentrated in the brain and nervous system tissue in an animal title: what your gut bacteria say about you

bulgaricus after a month of this regime volunteer in an fmri study at ucla s school of medicine showed brain activity that s associated with greater emotional stability a stronger connection between pain processing circuit and the prefrontal cortex compared with the non probiotic control group one explanation the good bacteria in yogurt send out signal that increase serotonin the neurotransmitter that famously reduces anxiety while most probiotic eater don t have big mood change say lead author kirsten tillisch md many anecdotally say they feel calmer over time ongoing research focus on the subtle cumulative long term effect of microbe a anxiety reducer your housemate influence you more than you think ok you don t like yogurt or kimchi tempeh sauerkraut or other friendly flora food but if your housemate eat them good news their healthy brain boosting microbe have probably taken up residence in you a number of gut microbe form so called spore environmentally hyper resistant cell that help to colonize them explains james scott professor of occupational environmental health at the university of toronto they re found on surface and in dust we inhale and ingest them you found wisdom among the dahlia a bacterium in soil called m vaccae may be a cognitive enhancer found a study published in behavioural process after mouse ate a peanut butter flavored dose of the bug they navigated maze twice a fast a those not treated turn out m vaccae are among the gut bacteria that trigger a rise in serotonin which not only calm u but also boost memory and concentration for mouse the superbrain effect lasted for at least a week after the last exposure we inhale and ingest this microbe when we re around dirt and plant to what extent might it help u navigate life s maze stay tuned you re hungry very very hungry surprisingly gut bacteria may also control appetite nudging you toward the oozy creamy crunchy food they like fact is the little bugger have specie specific appetite a microbiologist can tell what type of food you eat and predict whether you re slender or not just from the variety of microbe in your stool sample bad guy bacteria may be partly to blame for your junk food craving by for instance sending out sugar and fat jonesing signal via the gut to brain vagus nerve plus some microbe may help you extract more calorie from food and increase fat storage effectively making you put on weight you struggle to burn off your muffin top while the blame for a big belly doesn t lie entirely with it wee inhabitant the wrong microbe can contribute to it and make it harder to lose in a study led by liping zhao at shanghai jiao tong university a 385 pound patient had unusually high count of a fat loving bug called enterobacter in his gut zhao transferred the bacterium to his lab mouse and here s the shocker they became fat and diabetic control animal on the same high fat diet did not suggesting that enterobacter helped cause obesity a it turn out the bug trigger chronic low grade inflammation which lead to insulin resistance and weight gain the patient lost 113 pound in 23 week on a diet of whole grain and prebiotics nondigestible high fiber food example include garlic onion chicory root dandelion green and asparagus that feed friendly bacteria like the bifidobacterium in your yogurt and starve the bad within week the enterobacter wa completely wiped out you really love a smooth grenache good news here if you think dandelion green are more compelling when paired with a strong drink a study published in the american journal of clinical nutrition found that red wine s polyphenols those compound whose heart healthy benefit you ve heard so much about also have prebiotic potential just one glass 9 ounce of red wine daily for a month meaningfully boosted drinker ratio of good to bad gut bacteria compared with alcohol free and polyphenol free gin drinking control a caveat the benefit doesn t apply to sweet dessert wine which presumably feed the wrong microbiota sorry you have a high steak problem now consider pairing that grenache with something other than short rib the problem here is that certain red meat loving gut bacteria increase your heart attack risk found a study at the cleveland clinic when microbe digest compound in meat called carnitine and lecithin the liver us the byproduct to make an artery hardener that may be even more of a culprit in heart disease than cholesterol trimethylamine n oxide tmao note only if you have bacteria in your gut that are accustomed to meat vegan don t could you churn out tmao but burger lover be heartened scientist are working on way to identify and eventually target the villain bacteria
